Welcome to RestAPI contacts’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async contacts_api.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact[source]¶

Creates and saves contact in database

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact instance with all the needed parameters

  • user (User) – current user

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

Contact that is being saved

Return type:

Contact

async contacts_api.repository.contacts.find_contact(query: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact] | None[source]¶

Searches for a contact by sequence of characters in email, last name or first name.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – sequence used to search through database

  • user (User) – current user

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

matching records if found

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async contacts_api.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(user: User, db: Session)[source]¶

Checks who from saved contacts has birthday in a week

Parameters:

  • user (User) – current user

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

all contacts that have birthday in a week

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async contacts_api.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact[source]¶

Searches for a record by it’s index

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – searched index

  • user (User) – current user

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

contact with given index

Return type:

Contact

async contacts_api.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact][source]¶

returns every contact saved by current user

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – how many contacts will be skipped

  • limit (int) – max number of contacts displayed on one page

  • user (User) – current user

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

contacts saved in db by this user

Return type:

List[Contact]

async contacts_api.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None[source]¶

Removes a contact from database

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – index of contact to remove

  • user (User) – current user

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

contact that is being removed

Return type:

Contact | None

async contacts_api.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None[source]¶

Updates an existing contact in database

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – index of already existing contact

  • body (ContactModel) – new instance of contact to save

  • user (User) – current user

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

newly saved contact

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async contacts_api.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None[source]¶

Confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async contacts_api.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User[source]¶

Creates an user

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – Data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – database session.

Returns:

Newly created user.

Return type:

User

async contacts_api.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User[source]¶

Searches for an user in database by email

Parameters:

  • email (str) – email searched in database

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

user with searched email

Return type:

User

async contacts_api.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User[source]¶

Update the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar is being updated.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async contacts_api.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None[source]¶

Update the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose token is being updated.

  • token (Optional[str]) – The new refresh token. Can be None to remove the token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async contacts_api.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Create a new contact with rate limiting (10 requests per minute).

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The contact details to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

Created contact.

Return type:

ContactInDB

async contacts_api.routes.contacts.find_contact(query: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Find contacts by query with rate limiting (10 requests per minute).

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The search query.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If no contacts found.

Returns:

List of matching contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactInDB]

async contacts_api.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Retrieve upcoming birthdays with rate limiting (10 requests per minute).

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactInDB]

async contacts_api.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Retrieve a contact by ID with rate limiting (10 requests per minute).

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If contact not found.

Returns:

Retrieved contact.

Return type:

ContactInDB

async contacts_api.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 5, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Retrieve contacts with rate limiting (10 requests per minute).

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of records to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of records to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If contacts not found.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactInDB]

async contacts_api.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Delete a contact by ID with rate limiting (10 requests per minute).

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If contact not found.

Returns:

Deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactInDB

async contacts_api.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Update a contact by ID with rate limiting (10 requests per minute).

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated contact details.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If contact not found.

Returns:

Updated contact.

Return type:

ContactInDB

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

Current user’s details.

Return type:

UserDB

async contacts_api.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → UserDB[source]¶

Update current user’s avatar image.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Updated user details.

REST API routes Auth¶

async contacts_api.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Confirm user’s email address using verification token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The verification token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If verification error or email already confirmed.

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

async contacts_api.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

User login with email and password.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If invalid credentials or email not confirmed.

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

dict

async contacts_api.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Refresh access token using refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP Authorization credentials with refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If invalid refresh token.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

dict

async contacts_api.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Request email verification for unconfirmed user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request email details.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – The request details.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Message indicating email sent for verification.

Return type:

dict

async contacts_api.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Create a new user account.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user details to create the account.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – The request details.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException 409 – If account with email already exists.

Returns:

User creation response.

Return type:

dict

REST API service Auth¶

class contacts_api.services.auth.Auth[source]¶

Bases: object

Handles authentication operations such as password hashing, token creation, and verification.

ALGORITHM: str = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY: str = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str[source]¶

Creates an access token based on the provided data. :param data: Data to encode into the token. :param expires_delta: Expiration time delta in seconds (optional). :return: Encoded access token.

create_email_token(data: dict) → str[source]¶

Creates an email verification token. :param data: Data to encode into the token. :return: Encoded email verification token.

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str[source]¶

Creates a refresh token based on the provided data. :param data: Data to encode into the token. :param expires_delta: Expiration time delta in seconds (optional). :return: Encoded refresh token.

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str[source]¶

Decodes the refresh token to retrieve the email associated with it. :param refresh_token: Refresh token to decode. :return: Decoded email from the token. :raises HTTPException 401: If the token is invalid or has an incorrect scope.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Session[source]¶

Retrieves the current authenticated user based on the provided access token. :param token: Access token for authentication (dependency). :param db: Database session (dependency). :return: Current authenticated user session. :raises HTTPException 401: If credentials cannot be validated or user does not exist.

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str[source]¶

Retrieves the email from the provided email verification token. :param token: Email verification token to decode. :return: Decoded email from the token. :raises HTTPException 422: If the token is invalid.

get_password_hash(password: str) → str[source]¶

Hashes the provided password. :param password: Password to hash. :return: Hashed password.

oauth2_scheme: OAuth2PasswordBearer = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context: CryptContext = <CryptContext>¶
r: Redis = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_pass: str, hash_pass: str) → bool[source]¶

Verifies if the plain password matches the hashed password. :param plain_pass: Plain password to verify. :param hash_pass: Hashed password to compare against. :return: True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

REST API service Email¶

async contacts_api.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)[source]¶

Sends an email with a verification token for email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • email – Email address of the recipient.

  • username – Username of the recipient.

  • host – Host URL for email verification link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue connecting to the email server.
